"254 The Cheesy Poofs" needs to match with "2(54)", "t(he)", "c(heesy)", and "p(oofs)", but not necessarily "eesy". Events need to match by event code and partial event name. "2014 Silicon Valley Regional [CASJ]" needs to match with "2(014)", "s(ilicon)", "v(alley)", "r(egional)", and "c(asj)", but not necessarily "ilicon". Manager.description: My lack of experience with Android is really slowing down the development process on this. Let me outline how I believe the refreshing scheme should work. A refresh will consist of three steps: render, update, and render. Refreshes are triggered when starting an Activity or when the user manually refreshes. To support this, each Fragment needs to implement render() an update(). render() makes the appropriate SQL queries locally to fetch all the models needed to render a page, and then populates the Fragment with that info. It must be able to handle cases where not all data is in the local DB and display as much as possible. If feasible, each unique query should hold a lock with the result temporarily cached within the scope of the Activity, so multiple concurrent Fragments making the same queries can reuse the result. update() makes the fewest number of API calls needed to populate the local DB with everything the Fragment needs to render. Upon receiving an API response, we need to drop all table rows associated with that response (this should always be possible due to the way API endpoints are setup). For example, after receiving a response from /api/v2/team/frc254/event/2014casj/awards, award table rows satisfying the query eventKey = 2014casj AND winners LIKE %254% must be dropped (this isn't the most efficient, but will do for now) and new rows constructed from the response must be inserted. Also, the cached value of the SQL query made in render() must also be dropped. One key implementation detail of the update() method is that locks must be held for each unique API endpoint. This way, concurrent updates from multiple fragments that hit the same API endpoint don't make multiple requests to the same endpoint at once, and after one returns, we can rely on the API rate limit to prevent hitting the endpoint again. We should start by implementing everything without any of the caching and locks (but keeping them in mind) and adding them after.
Manager.title: New Data Storage Round 2

Manager.title: GCM for match reminder and scores of favorited teams

Manager.description: During competition, the event tab defaults to the current week, but I'm not sure this is enough. Consider adding "This week" or something to the top-level nav.
Manager.title: Better access of current events

Manager.description: Here's an idea. Have a view in HomeActivity that shows glanceable (gotta use our buzzwords 😉) cards for favorited teams and events. These cards would show the most relevant info for favorited teams and events, or prompt the user to favorite teams and events if none are favorited. The most recent cards would appear near the top. I'm thinking of having two types of cards initially: Event and Team@Event. The Event card would show last/next match and perhaps rankings. Team@Event would show team's last/next match and rank. We can make the card expand to show a team's entire match list as well as link to the full Team@Event activity. More ideas are welcome. Needs #212
Manager.title: Implement "Favorited" dashboard

Manager.description: The "Matches" tab sometimes shows the text No match results were found for this event. at a fixed position on the screen, overlapping with the scrolling list of match results. It does not happen every time. E.g., refreshing the results can make the symptom go away. Going back to the event list, repicking the event, and picking the "Matches" tab can make the symptom come back. I'm running the code from master (commit 8f54775)
Manager.title: "No match results" text overlapping match results text

Manager.description: I noticed today that after QF 2-1 was just played, it said that QF 2-2 is next (which is wrong, should be QF 3-1). We should just sort the match list by play order during active events, which will fix this.

Manager.description: http://developer.android.com/design/patterns/notifications.html Update notification priority to HIGH or LOW based on data (HIGH for incoming data pushes, LOW for test ping, etc) Give the user the ability to change priorities for different types of notifications - so on 5.0, they can select which types appear on the lock screen/as heads up Set category to CATEGORY_SOCIAL if it isn't already Implement setVisibility and allow the user to control if they want notifications to be on the lock screen or not. Test how the app responds when many notifications come in without being dismissed. They should collapse onto each other and update the content.
Manager.title: Update Notifications for 5.0
Fix "Converting to string" issue

Manager.description: The new implementation of tabs doesn't feel as smooth as it should, mainly when scrolling to tabs by touching the tab label (this is hard to put into words, but you'll see what I mean when you use the app). We should have the tab strip smoothly animate to the next selected tab; now that we have full control over the source code of it, this should be easier to do.
Manager.title: Animate scrolling of tabs

Manager.description: I turned on notifications for MadTown Throwdown match results. They must've just got their FMS connected to the internet since TBA suddenly poured in 50 notifications. It should only chime once and combine the news into a summary InboxStyle notification. http://developer.android.com/design/patterns/notifications.html#summarize_your_notifications
Manager.title: Summarize notifications, InboxStyle

Manager.description: After receiving many match-result notifications (cf #272 ), tapping on any of them opens the page displaying Quals 1 match results.
Manager.title: Tapping a match-result notification should display that match result page in TBA

Manager.description: Doing a web search on the phone for madtown throwdown webcast, the second result is for The Blue Alliance. Tapping that offers to open Chrome or TBA app. So pick the app. (It's great that Google provides a TBA search result but unfortunately the link is just to TBA home page, not the event page.) Picking TBA app shows the 2014 Events screen, "Week 1" tab. The URL didn't have the info to get directly to the relevant event, but the app could use today's date to pick the most relevant tab ("Offseason events"). After navigating to the event screen, I don't see how to get the webcast. There is a YouTube link that searches for videos mastching 2014mttd, none of them relevant. The desktop version of TBA home page links to the the Gameday page embedding the YouTube webcast. So if I Back up to step (1) and pick Chrome [1], the TBA mobile home page also has a Gameday page link. Tapping that again asks if I want to open it in Chrome or TBA app. Picking TBA app opens the right info screen for this Event, but no webcast. Picking Chrome gets a similar mobile page, also with webcast aid. It'll issue a different YouTube query #frcmttd OR "MadTown ThrowDown", which also doesn't work. [1] TBA app crashed at that point. Android sent a crash report. This is from a Nexus 5 running KitKat.
Manager.title: help the user access the webcast

Manager.description: After tapping a match result notification to open the app, tapping the action bar's "back" arrow should navigate upwards within the app, per Navigate to the right place, rather than return to the previous app. Creating a simple notification says how to use TaskStackBuilder to build an artificial back stack for the started Activity.
Manager.title: Notifications should build an artificial back stack so Back will go to the right place

Manager.description: On 5.0 (not sure how it looks on 4.x) there is very low contrast between the colored background of the match teams/scores table and the background of the activity. We should (yet again) reconsider the styling of the match views. Perhaps if we color the text itself and make it a little bigger, we could improve legibility? We also need to add ripple touch feedback to the individual team numbers. That should be pretty easy.
Manager.title: Update Match view styling

Manager.description: For example, says "Semis 2 match 1" instead of "Semis 1 match 2."
Manager.title: Elim notifications have match/set backwards

Manager.description: I installed the current release (2.0.1) on a Galaxy Nexus running Android 4.3 and a Nexus S running Android 4.1.2. They aren't showing the Notifications slide-up at the bottom of screens like an event's Matches tab. They repeatedly pop up a dialog asking to enable MyTBA even though I enabled MyTBA in the startup sequence (and it did successfully fetch my favorites) and in previous pop-up dialogs. I don't see anything interesting in logcat. Ah! Enabling MyTBA from Settings worked on both phones.
Manager.title: Trouble enabling MyTBA

Manager.description: This bug hasn't actually occurred, but I spotted the potential for it while looking for the source. I'll outline the potential scenario: A new event is added to the FIRST database. This get's pulled in by TBA. A user opens the event list on his/her device; the new event loads. That user favorites a event on one devices. The server sends a GCM message to another device that downloads the new list of favorites. The user opens myTBA on the second device without downloading the new event list. It attempts to load the list of favorites, but the new event is not in the local database. The app crashes. The user is sad. I guess the best way to fix this is simply to hide any entities that don't exist locally when loading the favorites list. That's probably an easy fix. However, I'm too tired to fix this now, so I'm just making note of it here.
Manager.title: Fix potential bug with myTBA

Manager.description: We should put an option to go straight to the settings of a particular model in each list item of the myTBA lists. That would be easy to implement: just have an activity that contains a NotificationSettingsFragment. This makes it easy for the user to just straight to the settings if they want to unfavorite/check subscription status/etc. It probably goes without saying, but we can use the gear icon for this.
Manager.title: Add "settings" icon to each row in myTBA

Manager.description: They are a weak in advance the events are correct in the way of the respectful weeks in the way they would go on during the season but it goes week 2 up to week 8
Manager.title: the weeks for 2015 are messed up

Manager.description: On the "info" pages of most models, there is a FAB that opens the fav/sub interface. However, when the content is tall enough, the FAB can cover portions of it. We have a few options in this case: a) add some padding or a blank view to the bottom of every list b) hide the FAB when you scroll down I like option A, because we could probably make an adapter to do that for us. B also wouldn't work if the content is just slightly shorter than the height of the screen, because then the view wouldn't be scrollable and you couldn't hide the FAB. Any thoughts on this?
Manager.title: Figure out what to do with the FAB

Manager.description: If you start the app from a cold state (not backgrounded, no tasks running),the profile picture in the nav drawer doesn't load. It will load on any subsequent activity creations (child activities, home activity recreated after orientation change), but it refuses to load on the first activity creation, even after being cached. The cover photo, however, does load.
Manager.title: Profile picture doesn't load on first activity creation

Manager.description: In some activities (at the very least, Team@Event), the Toolbar displays "The Blue Alliance" as the title until the actual title has been loaded. I think it would be better to default to an empty title until everything has loaded and the actual title can be displayed.

Manager.description: I was testing the app on my friend's S5 when I found this bug. I was on the events list on the home activity when I rotated the device. The events list turned into a progress indicator, like it should.... and the event list never reloaded. When I went into a team view, the event list wouldn't load there (not sure if this is related, but on the team page, the sub/fav settings list didn't load either). My guess is something is holding a lock to the events table and isn't letting go. The weird thing is that this isn't reproducible on my N5 running 5.0. No idea where to start with this one.
Manager.title: [URGENT] Rotating device breaks everything

Manager.description: Hi, I'm interested in creating a Blue-Alliance-like app for FTC. I know that FIRST doesn't release a lot of FTC match data (or any for this season, apparently), but complete team and event lists are accessible from the FIRST website. Ideally, an android app would exist that allows a user to enter team and match data for a tournament locally, compute local OPR, CCWM type stats for scouting, etc. and store results in a local database on the android device. Down the road in a dream world, FIRST and/or users could possibly upload data into a centralized database like what The Blue Alliance has achieved for FRC. Question: it seems like I could start with the Blue Alliance android app and modify it for FTC. Any advice on this? Good idea or bad idea? Should this be separate from The Blue Alliance or in some way integrated/ forked? Thanks in advance for any advice y'all can provide, Bill Gardner cheer4ftc.blogspot.com
Manager.title: Q: Android FTC app based off The Blue Alliance app?

When I taped their number, their event activity loaded. I then used the View Team option to see their name and other info. When I backed my way out to the Awards page, the name was displayed. I thought it was odd so I went to the Teams lists and swiped all the way over to the 5000-5999 section. As I scrolled down I got to the point where the names ended and only numbers were listed: I then picked the first team with no name and it loaded just fine. When I went back to the team lists that team now has a name: I tried selecting the Refresh option 5 times and it does not load the data for those higher number teams. The data only loads if I manually select each team. I tried to reproduce this on my Galaxy Tab 2 12 and it lists all of the teams. I checked my wifes G3 and the teams display fine. Should the Refresh option refresh the team info or do I need to try clearing the cache and maybe the existing data? Similarly, my Tab 2 lists team 5538 as "Jaguar Robots" but my G3 and the TBA web site list them as "DVHS Cyborgs". When I open the team on my Tab 2 it will say "DVHS Cyborgs" but when I go back to the view (and Refresh it on the Tab 2), the list view still says "Jaguar Robots".
Manager.title: Team list does not refresh

Manager.description: WANT TO HELP REWRITE THE APP? See #366 (comment) This ties in with #330 - we should really do a global rewrite this offseason to make the whole app cleaner, simpler, and testable. I'm thinking that I want to take a similar approach to this sample app: https://github.com/tehmou/rx-android-architecture but use rxandroid, which has some special android features. This example does a very good job of decoupling data loads from actually displaying the content, which I like. We're probably also going to want to cave and make a content provider for all the underlying data.
Manager.title: New App Structure

If we want to allow changes in this state, they should be updated locally and a message posted saying notifications would not begin until they get an internet connection. We can sync the preferences back to the server once internet comes back.
Manager.title: Offline myTBA Prefs

Manager.description: I propose that we remove the private option ("When Device is Unlocked") or the entire secret/private/visible Lock Screen Notifications choice because TBA notifications don't contain any private information. Notifications are a terrific feature. People should not have to find this setting, understand it, and set it to see them. The secret ("Never") vs. visible ("Always") choice has low utility -- would anyone who adds subscriptions and enables notifications want to hide them from the lock screen? At least the default should be visible, not private. (Would just changing the default in notification_preferences_lollipop.xml help users who didn't explicitly pick?)
Manager.title: remove the "private" option for notifications since they don't have any private data

Manager.title: Handle ef matches

Manager.description: Test case: Receive a push notification. (test_notification.py in #379 makes this easy.) Tap the resulting system notification to open a TBA activity. (To reproduce this bug, do not swipe away the notification or clear all notifications.) Receive another push notification. Result: A group summary notification that lists the new notification and the previously dismissed notification. Tap the summary notification. Result: That goes to the Recent Notifications activity, which currently clears the list of "active" notifications. So the next incoming notification will properly display all by itself. This seems to be caused by Android Issue 41253: The deleteIntent of the Notification doesn't get called when the user touches the Notification. The app creates notifications with setAutoCancel(true), which is supposed to make tapping the notification send its delete Intent (dismiss notifications) as well as its content Intent (open an Activity). But Android doesn't send the delete Intent in this case. Since the fix for #382 exacerbates this bug, I'll fix this in the same PR.
Manager.title: Notifications Not Being Marked As Read

Manager.description: It's still in the search indexes. Best fix is to update the database schema to have event key in the SearchEvent table be a foreign key and have deletes cascade so we don't have to worry about this problem. The simpler fix is to lazily delete search index for nonexstent events (so, delete when event is null and don't render). This is preferable to deleting indexes when the Events table is updated, because the delete is done via a SQL where clause, which we can't use to also delete the index (different tables).
Manager.title: Crash when search would display 'Carter'

Manager.description: When I try to view a teams historical events and their records I only see 2015 events: (Note that the year at the top is 2013, not 2015) It happens for any team. Here are the simple steps to get into this state: 1: Start the TBA app 2: Pull up the menu and select Teams 3: Select any team (I chose Team 1) 4: After the Info tab loads, select the Events tab. Their 2015 events display 5: Select the first 2015 event and let it load. 6: Press back to get to the Events tab. 7: From the year list at the top select any year (I chose 2013) The 2015 event data still displays. No matter what year I pick now (2014, 2011, etc) the events listed will only be for 2015. I reproduced this on my Galaxy S3 and my Galaxy Tab Pro 12.2 using the TBA 2.1.4.
Manager.title: Team historical event data does not always display

Manager.description: We should improve the design of the db this offseason Ideas: Remove search index tables. Make a row for indexes in Event/Team tables and query that using projection instead of having to worry about multiple tables Add foreign key constraints to the other tables (eventTeam, districtTeam, media, match, award) to relate to instances of teamKey and eventKey
Manager.title: [App v3] Database Updates

Manager.description: It's minor, but we have to be as #materialyolo as possible.
Manager.title: Match details activity lacks transparent status bar

Manager.description: When a summary notification exceeds 7 entries, it shows @17041057 for the rest. I verified that the app is passing the right data to NotificationCompatBuilder, and indeed a web search shows that it's an Android 5.1 bug. The bug does not appear to be in NotificationCompatJellybean so I think the choices are Live with it and hope Google fixes it. Rather than adding 8+ items to a summary notification on Android 5.1, add 6 items plus a "more..." line. That seems reasonable, although not a big deal.
Manager.title: Summary notification shows "@17041057" after #7

Manager.description: The next match time for team 1678: is 4 hours ago. It's easy to see what happened since the team's match schedule has gaps in posted match results: Strangely, the same problem does not happen for the field's match schedule: even though the field has two gaps in its posted match results (I could only fit one into a screen shot): [I'll look at the code.]
Manager.title: team's "next match time" is wrong after a data gap

Manager.description: It's an unpleasant experience to sit there during a refresh and have no idea what's going on. Refreshable activities should have a "Refreshing {info/matches/awards/etc}" when a refresh is in progress.
Manager.title: Add info snackbar when refreshing

Manager.description: Inspired by Spyder and as an extension of admin broadcasts, we should provide a way to have a persistent message appear for uses. We can make an unauthenticated endpoint to cloud endpoints and have the app hit it on startup. Messages could have 'title, 'content', 'expiration time' properties. If there's a message, we could display it as a persistent warning message until it's canceled or expired.
Manager.title: Admin Push Message to Users

Manager.description: Might as well take this easy step to achieving #materialyolo everywhere: https://github.com/afollestad/material-dialogs
Manager.title: Use Material Dialogs library

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Open a team details view for a team you haven't viewed before Switch quickly to the "events" tab While the events are loading, the list displays "no events found"; the list populates once the events are loaded. Not totally sure how to fix this one. Our data stack is so deep that it's going to be fun to track down why this happens :) will investigate.
Manager.title: Team view shows "No events found" while events are loading

Manager.description: I don't think the tabs really do a whole lot; if a user is looking for a specific team, they'll probably just search for it instead of swiping through some tabs and then scrolling through a list of 1000 teams. The tabs don't really do any harm by being there, but they don't really do much for the user, either. Commence debate.
Manager.title: Remove tabs from "Team" view

Manager.description: Hopefully FIRST will take the opportunity to work out the bugs with their API this summer and we'll have 100% uptime next year. However, I think we all know we can't expect that to be the case. I think we should shamelessly copy Spyder with their "FIRST's servers are down and there's nothing we can do about it" message. It probably makes sense to use the admin messaging feature for this most of the time, but there are still users who don't enable myTBA and therefore won't be registered for admin broadcasts. I think we have two options: either register every user with GCM (even those that aren't logged in) for basic admin messages, or have a simple "is FIRST working?" endpoint we can hit that will return a true/false flag. This flag could be set either manually if we know things aren't working, or automatically if fetching from FIRST starts failing.
Manager.title: Build in support for "FIRST API sucks" message

Manager.description: Moar guidelines! Adding "no items" messages like these would make the app a little more friendly. Something like a simple grey icon and short, to-the-point text centered on every empty page would look better than the "No found for this ." messages we currently have.
Manager.title: Follow "empty states" guidelines

Manager.description: Add Retrofit library and define an API interface with a single endpoint (use hose tba.com/api/v2) with the endpoint as a single paramter. This way, we can use Retrofit's capability to return an Observable with the network result. We need to migrate our network stack to work with Observables and have something consume them. We will need to refactor RefreshableHost a bit. I'm thinking it consumes all incoming network Observables for the Activity. The child Fragments can report which endpoints they require (some public static final variable, maybe) and be notified when each endpoint comes in, and when all requests are loaded. The RefreshableHost will hold all the content, which the children can query and process. This allows us to eliminate all the Populate* tasks
Manager.title: [App v3] Move Network Requests to Retrofit

Manager.description: In conjunction with #427, the network requests should return a (collection of) models which we can bind to views. We'll need to update the view to use the new framework, but it should allow us lots more flexibility https://developer.android.com/tools/data-binding/guide.html#viewstubs
Manager.title: [App v3] Data Binding

Manager.description: Need to add a new match type for EIGHTHs. Can display them as their own category (instead of as quarters). Make sure to update calculating team@event summaries
Manager.title: Proper Eighth Final Support

Manager.description: Should be just live ones
Manager.title: Webcasts Show For All Offseason Events

Manager.description: When I was first building the user info view (header, photo, name) in the nav drawer, I used our Lord Duarte's picture and name as placeholder data to test out how everything displayed. That stuff seems to still be there, although I've only seen it in debug builds, nothing that would be visible in production builds. However, it should still really be removed from our codebase. Part 2 of this (probably should be a separate issue) is that we really need a proper header in the nav drawer for users that aren't signed into myTBA. Perhaps something blue with the TBA logo? We need an art team...
Manager.title: Remove Matias DuARTe dummy data

Manager.description: On the branch with the new datafeed implementation, the ability to select a team year to view historical data is broken. This should be fixed before this is released to prod.
Manager.title: Fix team year selection

Manager.description: It's a minor detail, but one that we should get around to eventually. When a notification is received from GCM and processed, we should broadcast/event-bus that information so we can automagically update the recent notification list if it happens to be open at the time.
Manager.title: Make "Recent Notifications" list update when a new notification comes in

Manager.description: I originally posted this in the general TBA repo, it really belongs here. There seems to be several different versions of the "No internet"/"No connection"/"Couldn't load data"/"Data could be out of date" messages that are displayed when there's no network connection. As far as I can tell, they all mean exactly the same thing and should be triggered in the same situations. We should pick a single message and switch to using that everywhere where it is required.
Manager.title: Bring consistency to "No data" messages

Manager.description: In appv3-datafeed, the "Select Year" dialog in the teams activity shows years in ascending order. Recent years are probably more relevant to most people, so I think the list should go in reverse chronological order.
Manager.title: Invert ordering of team years participated

Manager.description: On the app, under 2016 events, the Palmetto Regional is listed under Week 1 rather than Week 0.5, offsetting the rest of the weeks by 1.
Manager.title: Week Listing for 2016 Events

Manager.title: Sort myTBA elements

Manager.description: While trying to fix #471, I ran into a rather weird issue. It seems as though that process throws the app into some sort of invalid state that causes the rendering of the main event lists to fail. Failure occurs across all years and is isolated to the top-level event lists; event lists within team views and event views themselves still function normally. Here is the offending stacktrace: E/tba-android: UNABLE TO RENDER W/System.err: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'java.lang.Object java.lang.ref.WeakReference.get()' on a null object reference W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.adapters.BindableFragmentPagerAdapter.setAutoBindOnceAtPosition(BindableFragmentPagerAdapter.java:38) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.fragments.EventsByWeekFragment.updateLabels(EventsByWeekFragment.java:130) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.binders.EventTabBinder.updateData(EventTabBinder.java:23) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.binders.EventTabBinder.updateData(EventTabBinder.java:10) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.subscribers.BaseAPISubscriber.lambda$bindData$33(BaseAPISubscriber.java:132) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.subscribers.BaseAPISubscriber.access$lambda$2(BaseAPISubscriber.java) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.subscribers.BaseAPISubscriber$$Lambda$3.call(Unknown Source) W/System.err: at rx.internal.schedulers.ScheduledAction.run(ScheduledAction.java:55) W/System.err: at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739) W/System.err: at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) W/System.err: at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:148) W/System.err: at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5417) W/System.err: at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) W/System.err: at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:726) W/System.err: at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:616) I tested the redownload process when I was first implementing it, so either I suck at testing, this is some weird edge case, or there's been a regression somewhere.
Manager.title: Redownload data causes errors with event list rendering

Manager.description: Now that the-blue-alliance/the-blue-alliance#1264 is merged, we can show GameDay feeds per event.
Manager.title: Show Individual Event/District Tickers

Manager.description: https://github.com/the-blue-alliance/the-blue-alliance-android/blob/master/android/src/main/java/com/thebluealliance/androidclient/adapters/TeamListFragmentPagerAdapter.java#L14 This is actually relevant now that we've run over the current max team number of 5999. Handling this properly will be interesting, because the number of teams we have in the database could change if we load in additional teams while the team lists are showing. Observable magic to the rescue? Or fire something on the EventBus when new teams are loaded and then check if we have to recompute the tabs? Open to ideas on the best way to handle this.
Manager.title: Don't hardcode max number of team pages

Manager.description: Every method in CacheableDatafeed that should be checked to make sure if writes/deletes from the db properly. We need to add the delete query parameters for responses that might change often (to make sure incorrect values don't get "suck" locally) and ensure that everything is written properly. Off the top of my head, all methods that return json things and anything that has to do with EventTeams (should construct EventTeam model in fetchEventTeams and write both the team list and EventTeam list) need to have db writing part hooked up
Manager.title: Double Check Cacheable Datafeed Properly Clears/Writes Values

Manager.description: When the data is initially loaded for the first time (nothing in db), the no data view is bound immediately, instead of after keeping the spinner visible until the network request gets fixed
Manager.title: TeamAtEvent Summary Binder Shows No Data Too Soon

Manager.description: Shows spinner forever. Need to investigate. Prerequisite to #437
Manager.title: Fix Webcast List Fragment

Manager.description: Current solution (just a view) doesn't play nice with FAB. We should update to a Snackbar, which should be able to handle all that. We should also abstract out the info message stuff from ViewEventActivity so that we can also show Admin Messages (see the-blue-alliance/the-blue-alliance#1303) without the warning decorations.
Manager.title: Update Info/Warning Messages

Manager.description: There needs to be a CoordinatorLayout somewhere in the view hierarchy for Snackbars to work, so we might as well put one in the view hierarchy that is ultimately used by the rest of the application. This should be a prerequisite for an ideal implementation of #501, where we can move showInfo()/showWarning() to NavigationDrawerActivity and have them be accessible from everywhere and consistent. (Side note: it's always bothered me how BaseActivity extends from NavigationDrawerActivity; shouldn't Base be the thing from which everything else is extended? Maybe that's just me. But as well as we're messing around this deep in code that hasn't been touched in months/years, we might as well look at this.)
Manager.title: Refactor NavigationDrawerActivity view to include a CoordinatorLayout

Running the current code in master, 4a3eac2: Once it fetches the initial data and the user continues past the startup screen, it opens a modal dialog: Are you sure you don't want to enable myTBA?
You can always enable it later in Settings.
CANCEL YES Wait, what? Does CANCEL mean "No, I don't want to enable myTBA", or "I'm not sure I don't want to enable myTBA", or "Don't do anything"? What does YES mean? Suggestion: Do you want to enable myTBA?
You can always enable it later in Settings.
NOW MAYBE LATER https://twitter.com/howardtayler/status/544526400674205698

Manager.description: From a (1 star) Play Store review: Getting error code (-505) Google's troubleshooting steps all failed. Uninstalled the app to reinstall and now I still can't install it and I don't have the old version either. Unrooted SGS 4 This doesn't appear to be an issue on our side, it's most likely an issue with 5.0 itself: http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/88214/how-do-i-deal-with-unknown-installation-error-code-505 We're going to try to get the reviewer to communicate with us via this issue so we can try to do further troubleshooting.
Manager.title: Installation failure, error -505

Manager.description: App side component to the-blue-alliance/the-blue-alliance#1362 Backend Tasks Update Cloud Endpoints to have a media suggestion url1. This will require some server side changes Integrate Imgur API into app2 Make a background thread thing (probably IntentService?) to take image on device, upload to imgur3, and suggest to TBA. Use persistent notification for status updates. Be sure to handle lots of cases: TCP Timeout, imgur error, rate limit hit Frontend Tasks Make a button to take a picture on Team or Team@Event page (do we want to be able to choose+upload existing picture?) Prompt user for image title and description. Provide sane defaults. Fire off above task 1 Cloud Endpoints Suggestion Needs to have: User (done via oauth). Will need to have account signed in/myTBA enabled Team Key Year Suggestion "kind" (media in this case) Imgur url Metadata (in this case, we want to pass deletehash up to the server so we can modify the image in the future, even though it was upload anonymously. And maybe some other stuff?) 2Imgur API Things Docs: https://api.imgur.com/ Other Considerations: Need to register app and get tokens Note rate limiting (1,250 uploads per day or approximately 12,500 requests per day), remaining quota in X-RateLimit-UserLimit response header. Image Upload Endpoint. Returns basic response. Here is what the response looks like: { "data": { "id": "rdwAFcH", "title": null, "description": null, "datetime": 1455648595, "type": "image\/jpeg", "animated": false, "width": 1200, "height": 675, "size": 784683, "views": 0, "bandwidth": 0, "vote": null, "favorite": false, "nsfw": null, "section": null, "account_url": null, "account_id": 0, "comment_preview": null, "deletehash": "BV0r1n6UoQayKlm", "name": "", "link": "http:\/\/i.imgur.com\/rdwAFcH.jpg" }, "success": true, "status": 200 } 3File Uploads With Retrofit https://github.com/square/retrofit/wiki/%5B1063%5D-How-to-upload-file---Retrofit---2.0
Manager.title: Team Media Suggestion Flow

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: open an event scroll to "Rankings" tab scroll to bottom of list click on last team once the activity loads, click "Back" (not up, that triggers a different issue) observe how after a second, the list jumps back to the top This actually applies to all tabs in the activity: if you swipe between several tabs, scroll them all down, then do the above process, they will all be scrolled to the top. There's no reason scroll position shouldn't be persisted. This appears in several places throughout the app, not only in the "Events" activity.
Manager.title: Bug: lists scroll to top when resuming activity

Manager.description: While investigating #545, I discovered that most (but not all) EventTeams aren't being cached in the database. Specifically, most of the time EventTeamsTable.getEvents(...) will return nothing due to an empty cursor, even after the cache definitely should have been populated with the appropriate things. There are some exceptions: on my device, Palmetto 2015 and 2016 are consistently cached, as are some other events (check out the database in Stetho to see exactly what's there). This doesn't really impact user experience, as the network requests will take care of populating things pretty quickly, but this should really be fixed for correctness' sake.
Manager.title: Most EventTeams not being cached locally

However, if you're in the activity and a new notification comes in, you're left with a disappointing and useless "summary" card for the new notification. Quitting and restarting the activity makes everything render nicely again.

Manager.description: I've only seen this behavior with the main teams list. When the lists come back into the foreground and we attempt to bind new data to them, we get a ton of these exceptions. The easy solution would just be to check if the list is null before accessing it, but the real question is why is the list null in the first place? The binder should be able to hold on to the reference to the ListView even when it goes into the background and then comes back into the foreground. 02-22 17:58:09.679 12892-12892/? Manager.description: I upgraded to 3.1.0, cleared my cache and then started using the app. I eventually got to the point where the match video page looked like an MTV flashback: The steps I took to get there (twice) were the following: 1: Start the app 2: From the 2016 Events view I select the Week 0 Offseason event in Merrimakc NH 3: Slide over to the teams list and selecte Team 125 4: Slide over to their matches and selected any of the video play options. (For the screenshots I selected Qual 3) 5: The match info displays at the top and the available videos appear below just fine eventually. 6: I start to scroll the display up to see all the video choices available. That is when a copy of the original the contents appear to "stick" in the background while contents scroll up: A little further gets me to: If I keep scrolling I get to the screenshot at the top. This reproduced 2 out of 3 times I tried it on my Samsung G6. 2 observations that may be relevant: 1: The video thumbnails took a while to load a couple times I was trying (and once when trying to reproduce). 2: One of the reproduced times my phone switched from Wi-Fi to 4G (stupid hospital Wi-Fi!). I noticed this because that time I did not get video thumbnails like the other times.
Manager.title: Match video page contents 'stick' sometimes when scrolling

It looks like we have limited control over how notification text is styles, so bolding should be possible: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23917127/how-to-highlight-left-hand-side-text-of-every-line-in-notification
Manager.title: Rich Text In Notifications

Manager.description: Currently, GameDay is the only nav drawer option that kicks off a separate activity; the rest just swap the appropriate fragment into the main activity. GameDay should behave this way too.
Manager.title: Integrate GameDay mode with main activity

Manager.description: The webcast list should either be restyled to match the Awards list (no dividers, padding at top), or replaced with a standard non-carded list. The latter may make more sense, as the content is homogenous like a team/event/etc list. We should look into grouping all an event's webcasts into a single card or list item for the case where an event has 2+ webcasts.
Manager.title: Fix webcast list styling

Manager.description: There is a glitch where every team member part of an alliance is marked as captain of the alliance.
Manager.title: Team alliance captain glitch

Manager.description: It should sort by play order when the event is live, and display order otherwise. This also affects the last/next match display on the info tab. Will update with screenshot when not on mobile
Manager.title: Live Events Elim Sort Wrong
Support Lib 23.2.0 Pre-L Crashes

Manager.description: Once the user clicks the FAB, it's obvious they know the upload feature exists; no need to keep reminding them!
Manager.title: Hide "media upload awareness" snackbar after user clicks upload FAB

Manager.description: For 2016 Sacramento stats, the Android app says High Score Quals: 162 in Q22 (correct), Playoffs: 172 in QF1-1 (no, that score was surpassed by 205 in SF1-1 and 192 in F1). The Insights web page is correct. Other stats differ between the Insights web page and the app's Event Stats, esp. Playoffs stats such as Average High Goals: 6 in the app, 4.91 on the web site Average Win Margin: 101 in the app, 56.69 on the web site Average Foul Score: 0 in the app, 3.59 on the web site Low Bar # Damaged / # Opportunities: 2 / 2 in the app, 30 / 32 on the web site
Manager.title: Incorrect Stats - Event Stats

I think the desired behavior should be to maintain the current year when switching modes if possible, or else default to the current year.

Manager.description: Thought for an enhancement to #668: have a dialog explaining what the letters indicate when you click on the elimination text. We all know what they mean, but I could see my parents being like "wat". Example copy: This alliance won the event! This alliance was eliminated in the octofinals.
Manager.title: Enhancement for #668: details dialog

Manager.description: We're still targeting API 22 this season for stability reasons (cans of worms and whatnot), but after champs, we'll bump it. 6.0 changes: http://developer.android.com/about/versions/marshmallow/android-6.0-changes.html Doze. We currently don't set priorities on our GCM message, but I think it's okay to leave them at normal. Runtime Permissions. We currently request GET_ACCOUNTS and WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE, which are considered Dangerous Permissions, so we'll have to implement requesting them at runtime. GET_ACCOUNTS is used at install time, I believe, to set up the device account when you sign into myTBA. WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is used to store suggested images taken before they're uploaded. I don't think any of the other changes should affect us. This library seems awesome for making runtime permissions easier
Manager.title: Updates for API 23

Manager.description: At Chezy Champs 2016 today, match scores finally started flowing through to TBA at 19:45 PT, after the event ended for the day. Then match score Firebase Cloud Messages (FCMs) started arriving every few seconds. I watched them arrive on a Nexus 7 Marshmallow tablet and a Nexus 5X Nougat phone. When I pulled down an FCM's notification view and let the view stay open, when following FCMs arrived, one or both devices played notification tones, Marshmallow accumulated additional lines in the app's notification view, but Nougat did not. When I swiped away the notification view on Nougat, those additional match-score notification lines never did appear although they are present in the app's Recent Notifications list, and the next incoming FCM would appear as a new notification view. Apparently, additional info arriving while the app's pull-down notification view is open doesn't successfully add to that view.
Manager.title: [Nougat] Notification Summary Broken

Manager.description:
While running a debug build, run the script scripts/test_notification.py awards-posted It sends a GCM to the client over adb. The client displays a notification but also logs a stack trace because a SQL constraint rejects an attempt to add the row to the DB without a key. E/SQLiteLog: (1299) abort at 8 in [INSERT INTO awards(name,enum,winners,year) VALUES (?,?,?,?)]: NOT NULL constraint failed: awards.key E/SQLiteDatabase: Error inserting name=Regional Chairman's Award enum=0 winners=[{"awardee":null,"team_number":2067},{"awardee":null,"team_number":78},{"awardee":null,"team_number":811},{"awardee":null,"team_number":2648}] year=2014 android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConstraintException: NOT NULL constraint failed: awards.key (code 1299) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConnection.nativeExecuteForLastInsertedRowId(Native Method) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConnection.executeForLastInsertedRowId(SQLiteConnection.java:782) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteSession.executeForLastInsertedRowId(SQLiteSession.java:788) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteStatement.executeInsert(SQLiteStatement.java:86) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.insertWithOnConflict(SQLiteDatabase.java:1471) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.insert(SQLiteDatabase.java:1341) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.database.ModelTable.add(ModelTable.java:44) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.database.ModelTable.add(ModelTable.java:69) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.database.writers.AwardListWriter.write(AwardListWriter.java:23) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.gcm.notifications.AwardsPostedNotification.updateDataLocally(AwardsPostedNotification.java:120) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.gcm.GCMMessageHandler.handleMessage(GCMMessageHandler.java:199) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.gcm.GCMMessageHandler.onHandleIntent(GCMMessageHandler.java:127) at android.app.IntentService$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(IntentService.java:65) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:135) at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:61)
The script's JSON data differs from what the doc page says in that the "event_key": "2014necmp", property is at a different level of the data structure, but moving that field to match the doc causes com.google.gson.JsonParseException: Notification data does not contain 'event_key' It seems the code is failing to include a DB key in the SQL INSERT.
Manager.title: `INSERT INTO awards(name,enum,winners,year)` needs a key

Steps to (sometimes) reproduce: Start an Android API level 21 or later emulator. Launch the app. Tap the Back button to return to the home screen. From a terminal window in the the-blue-alliance-android/ directory, run scripts/test_notification.py upcoming-match. This should open a heads-up notification shade. Wait for the notification shade to roll up. (This step might not be needed.) Run scripts/test_notification.py match-score. This should open another heads-up notification shade. Pull down the heads-up notification shade. This should reveal TBA's summary notification, "2 new notifications". Tap on the summary notification's content area.

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Upgrade from the current release to today's beta release (4.0.0, 2/20/17 11:44, commit 16424d8). Open the app and proceed to download the data updates. Tap to finish that. IIRC it now shows "2017 Events". Tap the Back button. Result: There are no navigational controls here besides the 3 system buttons at the bottom, not even a left side Nav Drawer. (The first time, I dived into a preseason event and myTBA between steps 3 and 4. I did the shorter sequence above on another Android.) This is a very minor problem. Tapping the Back button again exits the app. But the Back stack has occasionally done some weird things for a while.
Manager.title: There's a solid screen in the Back stack

Manager.description: Doesn't seem to happen all the time. It's because we sometimes haven't loaded the APIv3 token yet, so we're getting 400s back. We should make that logic a little more resilient to this kind of thing
